verses.content: The Lord says: Did I send you away? Did I leave you forever? The Lord says: Where is the divorce paper for your mother? Which person did I sell you to? Who did I sell you to? You sold yourselves because of your sins. Your mother was sent away because of your bad choices.

So when I came, no one was there. When I called, no one answered. House of Israel, is my hand too short to save you? Don't I have power to rescue you? I can dry up the sea with my words. I make rivers into deserts. Their fish stink because the water is dried up. They die of thirst.
I make the sky dark. I cover it with rough cloth.
The Lord God gave me the words of someone wise. I know how to speak to you when you are tired, House of Israel. He wakes me every morning. He wakes my ear to listen like a student.
The Lord God opened my ear. I didn't disobey. I didn't turn away.
I let people hit my back. I let them pull out my hair. I didn't hide my face when they made fun of me and spit on me.
The Lord God will help me. So I won't be confused. I made my face strong like a hard rock. I know I won't be ashamed.
The Lord is near. He says I'm right. Who wants to fight me? Let's stand together. Who is against me? Let them come close. I will defeat them with the strength of my words.
The Lord God will help me. Everyone who says I'm wrong will get old like clothes. Moths will eat them.
Who among you respects the Lord? Who obeys his servant's voice? Who walks in the dark without any light?
All of you who start fires and make sparks around yourselves: Walk in the light of your own fire. Walk in the sparks you made. This is what you'll get from me: You will lie down in sadness.

headings.text: The Lord Did Not Leave You
A Warning About Making Your Own Light
